recipe:item.NXkkUWRu: {"id":"NXkkUWRu","lastModified":"2016-02-05T02:24:58.033798Z","names":["Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan","Eggplant in a Peanut-Sesame Gravy"],"description":"Fried eggplant in a rich peanut and sesame gravy, a legacy of the Nizam rule of Hyderabad in India","steps":[{"text":"To prepare the eggplants","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"If using small baby eggplants, leaving the stem intact, make 5 slits (like *) along the length of the eggplant. It is important that the eggplant is held together at the stem","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Otherwise, simply cut into large cubes","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Deep fry in hot oil, drain on kitchen towels and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Use a {deep fryer} if you want to. A deep saucepan will do just as well","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"To make the gravy","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Cook the tamarind with ┬¢ cup of water in the {microwave} on high for 30 seconds. Cool and squeeze out the tamarind juice. Discard the seeds and fibre and set the juice aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Roast the peanuts, sesame seeds, khus-khus (poppy seeds) and dry coconut until everything starts to brown","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Grind along with the green chillies. Add up to 1 cup of water in small amounts to facilitate grinding and make a smooth paste","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Use a {spice mill}, {Indian mixie grinder} or {magic bullet} or something similar. Regular blenders are too large, so they will just toss the contents around instead of grinding them","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"In a saucepan, heat 3 tbsp of oil. Add fenugreek seeds, mustard seeds, curry leaves and a pinch of asafoetida and fry till the mustard seeds splutter","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add ginger-garlic paste, coriander powder, cumin powder and turmeric and saute for a minute","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the ground peanut-sesame paste and fry until you can see oil starting to separate from the mixture. Keep stirring and don't let anything stick to the pan","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the tamarind juice and 2 cups of water, season with salt and bring to a boil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Bring down to a simmer, add the fried eggplant and cook covered for 5 minutes","decorator":"Text"}],"totalTimeInMinutes":60,"servings":"Serves 7-8","approved":true,"spiceLevel":"Hot","region":"Indian Subcontinent","chefId":"auth0|5710de6b3c7ae40538abdc35","imageId":"QjWTNJiJ","ingredients":[{"text":"500 g eggplants, use whole baby eggplants or alternatively cut into large chunks","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"oil, for deep frying","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the gravy","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"┬¢ cup peanuts","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬╝ cup sesame seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp white poppy seeds or khus-khus, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¥ cup dried coconut, shredded, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"5-6 green chillies (adjust based on your spice/heat tolerance)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"20 g tamarind","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"3 tbsp oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tsp turmeric powder","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp ground coriander","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp ground cumin","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste or ┬¢ tbsp ginger, crushed and ┬¢ tbsp garlic, crushed","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1┬¢ tsp mustard seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ tsp fenugreek seeds, optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"10-12 curry leaves","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"a pinch of asafoetida (hing)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Salt, to taste","decorator":"Text"}],"cuisine":"South Indian","ingredientIds":["N2YXf2ns","NjTiracx","bVx2xwma","7lZzLbgx","jnZf_ewk","Mqf6ueTW","pkodzwcN","1Af_VldR","-GB41Pde","DfgIn-bx","_hfTfh3z","gekWvr9Y","4qfpoFAN","hr8-r0DU","nbfmHKxW","uB6jpbJQ","w6QRWRBb","b6ldX3JK","JKsRsdaq"],"overnightPreparation":false,"collections":["Curries","Side dishes"],"vegan":true}
recipe:item.3uDSc4Vg: {"id":"3uDSc4Vg","lastModified":"2016-02-05T02:25:54.6419062Z","names":["Hyderabadi Vegetable Dum Biryani","Slow-Cooked Spiced Vegetables and Rice"],"description":"A slow-cooked fragrant and spicy rice dish, a legacy of the Nizam rule in Hyderabad in India","steps":[{"text":"Warm ┬¢ cup of milk, add the saffron strands and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Fry the raisins and cashews in 3 tbsp of ghee and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To cook the rice","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Mix the salt, oil and shahi jeera (black cumin seeds) in 6 cups of water in a large pot and bring to a boil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the rice and cook until just done. The rice should be slightly undercooked","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Drain well, spread the rice on a large tray and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To make the vegetable mixture","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Cook the vegetables (covered) with ┬¢ cup of water in the {microwave} on high for 12 minutes. Drain and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Dry roast bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, pepper and cumin seeds for 2 minutes or until they become strongly aromatic. Grind to a fine powder and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Heat the ┬¢ cup of oil in a large saucepan. Add shahi jeera (black cumin seeds), ginger-garlic paste and green chillies. Saute for a minute","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Add the ground spice mixture, ground nutmeg, lemon juice, salt and all the vegetables. Cook for 5 minutes to allow the vegetables to absorb some of the flavours","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Mix in kasoori methi (dried fenugreek leaves), turn off the heat and set aside","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"To slow-cook the rice and vegetables together","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"Use a large pot with a heavy lid","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the vegetable mixture on the bottom of the pot. Top with a layer of ┬¢ cup of yoghurt. ","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the chopped mint leaves and fresh coriander, followed by half of the rice. Sprinkle half of the saffron-milk mixture over the rice","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Spread half of the fried raisins and cashews along with some ghee on top","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Repeat this process with the remaining halves of all the mixtures in the same order starting with the vegetables and ending with the cashews and raisins","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Cover and place the pot on a low flame and cook for ┬¢ hour","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"If the lid is not heavy enough and you can see steam escaping the pot, you can also wrap it with a damp cloth","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"If you are worried about the vegetable mixture sticking to the bottom of the pot and burning, place the pot in a shallow pan that is wider than the pot. Fill the pan with 1 cup of water and place the whole assembly on the stove. Nothing will burn, promise!","decorator":"Quote"},{"text":"Serve hot with {Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan}","decorator":"Text"}],"totalTimeInMinutes":90,"servings":"Serves 7-8","approved":true,"spiceLevel":"Hot","region":"Indian Subcontinent","chefId":"auth0|5710de6b3c7ae40538abdc35","imageId":"ip8GhIId","ingredients":[{"text":"For the jeera)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tbsp oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp salt","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the vegetable mixture","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"2 bay 1┬¢ tsp ground black pepper","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1┬¢ tsp cumin seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬╝ tsp ground nutmeg","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"┬¢ cup oil","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste or 1 tbsp ginger, crushed and 1 tbsp garlic, crushed","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 tsp shahi jeera or caraway seeds","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"8-10 green chillies, cut into large pieces (adjust based on your spice/heat tolerance)","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"100 g green beans, cut into 1\" optional","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"Salt, to taste","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup yoghurt, whisked till smooth","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"2 cups fresh mint leaves, chopped","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"1 cup fresh coriander, chopped","decorator":"Text"},{"text":"For the garnish","decorator":"Heading"},{"text":"a fat pinch of saffron strands,
